intro: Silphium trilobatum, commonly known as the three-lobed silphium, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features broad, heart-shaped leaves with three distinct lobes, and it produces yellow to orange ray flowers. Silphium trilobatum is known for its medicinal properties, particularly its use in traditional herbal remedies. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
